title: Sarah Palin Testifies in Defamation Case Against New York Times
sub_head: Former vice presidential nominee, Alaska governor says she was distressed by editorial linking her political rhetoric and gun violence
body:
Former Republican vice-presidential candidate Sarah Palin testified Thursday in support of her allegations that she was libeled by the New York Times , but suffered a blow when the presiding judge said he would not allow punitive damages against the newspaper.
Ms. Palin, a former Alaska governor, said in Manhattan federal court that she was mortified by the Timesâ€™s publication of a 2017 editorial that suggested a link between her political speech and gun violence. She told jurors that as a national political figure she expected to be the subject of attacks, but said the Times had crossed a line.
